page.title: 14WALDRIDGE FELL COUNTRY PARK
page.content: County Durham's last surviving lowland heath(moorland near sea level)covers 300 acres.There is access to the whole Fell with a choice of car parks and waymarked walks.The Fell warden runs a Nature Trail and likes moths best of all the insects.At home he studies insects under a microscope.He thinks butterflies will become rare on the Fell,especially the Pearl-Borded Fritillary.Many people use the Trail including Americans and Australians.It is used by the general public three times a year but school parties regularly use it.The natural beauty and importance of the Fell is now being valued both locally and nationally.
